intro: Friesodielsia subaequalis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed fritillary, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lanceolate, often with a hairy texture. It is a short-lived perennial, blooming in early summer and attracting various pollinators.
